column1: The '''{{PAGENAME}}''' were creatures of iron and bronze forged by the smiths of [[Morgoth|Melko]] within the pits of [[Angband]]. They were only ever used against the peoples of [[Gondolin]] during its [[Fall of Gondolin|fall]].
It was [[Maeglin|Meglin]] who first conceived of the creation of monsters of fire and iron
column2: and he brought this idea to Melko during his betrayal.<ref name=Fall>{{LT2|III}}</ref>{{rp|169}} When they came against Gondolin
column3: they piled against the northern gate where the [[Orcs]] within would swarm into the breach.<ref name=Fall/>{{rp|176}}

column2: it can be said that the Iron Dragons were inanimate in nature.<ref>{{LT2|IIIn}} p. 213</ref> They were made by the most cunning of Melko's smiths and sorcerers. Their iron was expertly linked
column3: so that they could coil and crawl like slow rivers over difficult terrain. Within these devices were Orcs armed with scimitars and spears
column4: ready to emerge at need. It is said that after their appearance at Gondolin
column5: such devices would not be seen again until the [[Dagor Dagorath|Great End]].<ref name=Fall/>{{rp|170}}
